stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • stock.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
    A Stock object is a HashMap of items and their quantities. The items serve as keys, with their respective quantities being their associated values. Stocks can be added together, Items can be added or removed from Stock, and the stock can be returned in various formats to the caller.
    Author:
    Alex Koppon

    • Method Detail

      • addItems

        public void addItems(Item item)
              throws StockException
        Adds the passed item to the stock with a quantity of 0
        Parameters:
        item -
        Throws:
        StockException - if the item already exists in stock

      • addItems

        public void addItems(Item item,
                     int quantity)
        Adds the passed item to the stock with the quantity given. If the item already exists, then the quantity given is added to the current quantity of the item.
        Parameters:
        item -
        quantity -

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the int value of the quantity of an item using the itemName. If the item is not present 0 is returned.

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity(Item item)
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        the int value of the quantity of an item using the Item. If the item is not present 0 is returned.

      • removeItems

        public void removeItems(Item item,
                        int quantity)
                 throws StockException
        Removes the given quantity of an item from stock
        Parameters:
        item -
        quantity -
        Throws:
        StockException - if the quantity of the item being removed is greater than the amount contained in stock, or the item doesn't exist in stock

      • getList

        public java.lang.String getList()
        Returns:
        a string of the items contained in stock. Each row in an item and its properties E.g. "itemName,itemCost,itemPrice,itemReorderPoint,itemReorderAmount,[itemTemperate,N/A]\n"

      • addStock

        public void addStock(Stock stock2)
        Adds the items in the passed stock2 to the current stock. In the case of no such item existing, a new item is made with the given quantity, and if an item already exists, the quantity of the item from stock2 is added to its quantity in the existing stock.
        Parameters:
        stock2 -

      • removeStock

        public void removeStock(Stock stock2)
                 throws StockException
        Removes the items in the passed stock2 from stock
        Parameters:
        stock2 -
        Throws:
        StockException - if there is no such item to remove from the stock or the quantity of the item is lower than the quantity being removed or the item doesn't exist in stock

      • toSet

        public java.util.Set<Item> toSet()
        Returns:
        a Set to assist in iterating through a stock array

      • getArrayList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getArrayList()
        Returns:
        an arraylist where each String is an item and its properties

      • getTotalQuantity

        public int getTotalQuantity()
        Returns:
        the total quantity of all items in the stock as an int

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(java.lang.String itemString)
